question: Why do you want to become an occupational therapist?
What qualities do you think make a good occupational therapist?
Tell me about yourself.
Why did you choose our OT program?
What are your greatest strengths and weaknesses?
How do you handle stress?
What do you see as the biggest challenge facing occupational therapy today?
Where do you see yourself in 10 years?
What will you do if you are not accepted to OT school this year?
Describe your most meaningful occupational therapy experience.
Tell me about a time you worked as part of a team.
Describe a time you had a conflict with a team member. How did you resolve it?
Tell me about a time you failed. What did you learn?
Describe a situation where you had to adapt to a significant change.
Give an example of a time you demonstrated leadership.
Tell me about a time you made a mistake. How did you handle it?
Describe a time you had to deliver bad news.
Tell me about a time you had to make a difficult ethical decision.
Describe a time you had to advocate for someone else.
Tell me about a time you had to learn something quickly.
Describe a time you had to work with someone difficult.
Tell me about a time you had to persuade someone.
Describe a time you had to handle a crisis.
Tell me about a time you had to be creative.
Describe a time you had to work under pressure.
Tell me about a time you had to solve a complex problem.
Describe a time you had to take initiative.
Tell me about a time you had to deal with criticism.
Describe a time you had to balance multiple priorities.
Tell me about a time you had to work with limited resources.
How would you handle a patient who refuses treatment?
What would you do if a patient couldn't afford treatment?
How do you feel about patient autonomy in occupational therapy?
What would you do if you made a treatment error?
How would you handle a patient with unrealistic recovery expectations?
What would you do if a patient lied about their symptoms?
How do you feel about treating patients with mental health challenges?
Is it ethical to refuse to treat a patient?
How would you handle a patient who wants unnecessary treatments?
What would you do if you witnessed unprofessional behavior?
What appeals to you about our OT curriculum?
How will you contribute to our OT program community?
What do you hope to gain from our program?
What specialty are you interested in and why?
How do you plan to handle the academic rigor of OT school?
What do you know about our school's mission and values?
How do you plan to get involved in research or extracurriculars here?
What do you think sets our program apart from others?
How will you handle living in this city/state?
What concerns do you have about starting OT school?
What is your opinion on the current state of occupational therapy in the US?
How has COVID-19 changed your perspective on occupational therapy?
What are your thoughts on telehealth in occupational therapy?
How should occupational therapy address health disparities?
What do you think about the cost of occupational therapy?
How should occupational therapy coverage be improved?
What are your thoughts on mental health integration in OT?
How should we address the shortage of OTs in rural areas?
What do you think about the integration of technology in occupational therapy?
How should we address the cost of occupational therapy education?
